009package imagingbook.common.color.colorspace;
010
011import java.awt.color.ColorSpace;
012
013/**
014 * <p>
015 * Implementation of a D50-based XYZ color space, as a substitute for Java's built-in standard connection space
016 * (obtained with {@code  ColorSpace.getInstance(ColorSpace.CS_CIEXYZ)}), with improved accuracy. The reference white
017 * point of this color space is D50 and any XYZ coordinate passed to {@link #fromCIEXYZ(float[])} is assumed to be
018 * relative to D50 as well, thus no conversion (color adaptation) is necessary between XYZ values. See Sec. 14.1.1 of
019 * [1] for details.
020 * </p>
021 * <p>
022 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer
023 * (2022).
024 * </p>
025 *
026 * @author WB
027 * @version 2022/11/14
028 * @see XYZ65ColorSpace
029 */
030@SuppressWarnings("serial")
031public class XYZ50ColorSpace extends ColorSpace {
032
033        private static final sRGB65ColorSpace srgbCS = sRGB65ColorSpace.getInstance();
034        private static final XYZ50ColorSpace instance = new XYZ50ColorSpace();
035        
036        public static XYZ50ColorSpace getInstance() {
037                return instance;
038        }
039        
040        private XYZ50ColorSpace() {
041                super(TYPE_XYZ, 3);
042        }
043
044        // -------------------------------------------------
045
046        @Override       // convert (D50-based) thisXYZ50 to sRGB
047        public float[] toRGB(float[] thisXYZ50) {
048                return srgbCS.fromCIEXYZ(thisXYZ50);
049        }
050
051        @Override       // convert sRGB to (D50-based) thisXyz
052        public float[] fromRGB(float[] srgb) {
053                float[] thisXyz = srgbCS.toCIEXYZ(srgb);
054                return thisXyz;
055        }
056        
057        // -------------------------------------------------
058
059        @Override
060        public float[] toCIEXYZ(float[] thisXYZ50) {
061                return thisXYZ50;       // nothing to do since D50-based XYZ already
062        }
063
064        @Override
065        public float[] fromCIEXYZ(float[] XYZ50) {
066                return XYZ50;           // nothing to do, since D50-based XYZ is what we want
067        }
068        
069}
